1f2e902d-f6e3-42bd-a7b0-27ae5f80e345.description: Individuals who have earned this credential have completed the Executive Leadership Program offered by the Michael J. Coles of Business at Kennesaw State University. These Digital Badge earners have demonstrated a deep understanding of the eight leader roles that drive individual and organizational success: Leader as Director, Leader as Producer, Leader as Mentor, Leader as Facilitator, Leader as Monitor, Leader as Coordinator, Leader as Innovator, and Leader as Broker.
1f2e902d-f6e3-42bd-a7b0-27ae5f80e345.name: Leadership Excellence

badge_template_activities.title: Completed 10 program levels related to leadership excellence.
Completed 40 quests and 250 learning challenges.
Completed 10 work-related to-do assignments.
Completed approximately 40 hours of online learning.

41cffb55-b54a-4845-a289-2ed302f4bd81.description: Individuals who have earned this credential have completed the Webinar Wednesday Series on Leadership Excellence co-hosted by Kennesaw State University and local Chambers of Commerce. These Digital Badge earners have demonstrated an understanding of the eight leader roles that drive individual and organizational success: Leader as Director, Leader as Producer, Leader as Coach, Leader as Communicator, Leader as Monitor, Leader as Coordinator, Leader as Innovator, and Leader as Change Agent.
41cffb55-b54a-4845-a289-2ed302f4bd81.name: Leadership Excellence (Webinar Series)

badge_template_activities.title: Completed 10-12 hours of instructor-led online content.

c1ef24e4-f142-48f7-90b4-d6d4c4214294.description: Earners of the "Online Course Facilitation Program" have developed the skills need to effectively facilitate an online course. They are competent in skills such as careful planning for online delivery, modeling an online course in such a way that participants become less dependent up the online facilitator, promoting online interaction in a course, being cognizant of participants' motivation for taking an online course, and creating forums to make expectations clear to students.
c1ef24e4-f142-48f7-90b4-d6d4c4214294.name: Online Course Facilitation Program

badge_template_activities.title: Copy a model D2L course into a blank D2L course section.
Creating a checklist of items to update in your online course.
Creating instructor presence by using tools and practices to communicate with students while keeping them engaged.
Practice providing prompt feedback to your students.

f720ce7f-5398-4554-99f6-42e649e4ab0f.description: The “Online Course Design” workshop provides participants with the foundational knowledge for designing, developing, and implementing a quality online course. Participants are provided with technical and pedagogical strategies in alignment with effective online teaching practices. Participants that complete this workshop will have designed and developed a foundational course shell that they can use to further develop an online course.
f720ce7f-5398-4554-99f6-42e649e4ab0f.name: Online Course Design

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a course alignment map.
Design and develop a course shell and personalize as needed.
Create a syllabus utilizing various elements of an accessible document.
Develop one full module of instruction that includes all assessments, assignments, discussions, quizzes, and/or learning activities for that module.

0eac6029-968f-412c-904d-4f16592d2f60.description: Individuals who have earned this credential have completed the Account Management Program offered by the Tenacity Center for Account Management and Client Retention at Kennesaw State University. These digital badge earners have demonstrated a deep understanding of the fundamentals of effective account management including: Understanding and Managing Expectations, Building and Nurturing Relationships, Delivering Technical Expertise, and Maximizing Client Retention.
0eac6029-968f-412c-904d-4f16592d2f60.name: Account Management

badge_template_activities.title: Completed 7 program levels related to the Clients for Life process.
Completed 28 quests and 150 learning challenges.
Completed 12 work-related to-do assignments.
Completed approximately 30 hours of online learning.

a54d7b88-c881-45b7-8cc8-3e441299461d.description: Individuals who have earned this credential have completed an Exec Ed Flex online program in Customer Centricity offered by the Coles College of Business at Kennesaw State University and developed by The Sheth Leadership Academy founded by Dr. Jagdish Sheth. Topics covered: What Is Customer Centricity?; Evolution of Marketing; Aligning Marketing Strategy with Customer Needs; Competitive Advantage through Customer Loyalty; Managing Customer Expectations; Human-Centered Approach to Social Change.
a54d7b88-c881-45b7-8cc8-3e441299461d.name: Customer Centricity

badge_template_activities.title: Completed 7 online program levels related to customer centric marketing; Completed 20 quests and 154 learning challenges. Completed 6 work-related to-do assignments. Completed approximately 12 hours of online learning.

skills.name: Align Marketing Strategy With Customer Needs

b200a4ca-03d0-4a55-9937-8cbaabbdfc35.description: Individuals who have earned this credential have completed the Fundamentals of Professional Selling online program offered by the Center for Professional Selling at Kennesaw State University. The topics covered: Developing the mindset of top performing salespeople; Building the foundational selling process; Understanding the buyer's mindset; Prospecting strategies and skills; Presenting value-driven solutions; Managing customer objections; and successfully gaining commitment.
b200a4ca-03d0-4a55-9937-8cbaabbdfc35.name: Professional Selling (Fundamentals)

badge_template_activities.title: Completed 5 online program levels related to professional selling.
Completed 16 quests and 100 learning challenges.
Completed 4 work-related to-do assignments.
Completed approximately 20 hours of online learning.

14df4d2f-6fa4-4cb9-8501-91471071ba28.description: Earners of the "Accessibility Basics" provides opportunities to discover strategies for designing instruction and academic materials to meet the needs of students with disabilities and diverse learning needs. Participants are introduced to KSU's Web Accessibility Policy, the W3C's WCAG 2.0 AA standards, Section 508 guidelines, basic tenants of the Americans with Disabilities Act, and principles of Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act as it informs higher education policy.
14df4d2f-6fa4-4cb9-8501-91471071ba28.name: Accessibility Basics

badge_template_activities.title: Creating documents for instruction utilizing various elements of accessible documents.
Creating or ordering closed captioning or transcript for video or audio used for instruction.
Creating a checklist of items to review for the web accessibility of your online or hybrid courses.

9c0a9460-ffe7-4c68-bcb7-02bb979ffa5c.description: Ribbon earners can effectively implement and employ strategies to increase student engagement through D2L’s Discussions tool and the use of Intelligent Agents.
9c0a9460-ffe7-4c68-bcb7-02bb979ffa5c.name: Engagement

badge_template_activities.title: Attend Session 3 of the summer series workshop- Enhanced Face-to-Face Instruction: Making D2L Work for You!
Complete Session 3 milestone included in the accompanying course.

7b781cea-f6ea-4a0b-8c20-6e4240a7a058.description: Ribbon earners have a foundational understanding of incorporating accessible documents into a flipped classroom.
7b781cea-f6ea-4a0b-8c20-6e4240a7a058.name: Accessible Documents - Flipped Experience

badge_template_activities.title: Attend Session 1 of the summer series workshop- Enhanced Face-to-Face Instruction: Making D2L Work for You!
Complete Session 1 milestone included in the accompanying course.

6efa0d98-cc0b-42cc-93ad-2ef742d05da9.description: Ribbon earners can upload, edit, and apply machine captioning to videos via MediaSpace for use in a flipped classroom experience.
6efa0d98-cc0b-42cc-93ad-2ef742d05da9.name: Accessible Videos - Flipped Experience

badge_template_activities.title: Attend Session 2 of the summer series workshop- Enhanced Face-to-Face Instruction: Making D2L Work for You!
Complete Session 2 milestone included in the accompanying course.

73531d30-bb0f-47b0-9ce9-9f74ee259d47.description: Ribbon earners have demonstrated critical thinking in devising an emergency/communication plan that allows for smooth transition between modalities.
73531d30-bb0f-47b0-9ce9-9f74ee259d47.name: Communication

badge_template_activities.title: Attend Session 5 of the summer series workshop- Enhanced Face-to-Face Instruction: Making D2L Work for You!
Complete Session 5 milestone included in the accompanying course.

c014ca5a-e104-42ee-a6cb-ac68e82aed85.description: Ribbon earners have demonstrated foundational understanding in applying learning analytics to their course(s) using the following tools in D2L: Class Progress, Rubrics, and Assignments.
c014ca5a-e104-42ee-a6cb-ac68e82aed85.name: Continuous Improvement

badge_template_activities.title: Attend Session 6 of the summer series workshop- Enhanced Face-to-Face Instruction: Making D2L Work for You!
Complete Session 6 milestone included in the accompanying course.

a12b6a00-e4bd-4f0b-b15d-947cf57b30f1.description: Ribbon earners have demonstrated competency in using the D2L Quizzes and Grades tool.
a12b6a00-e4bd-4f0b-b15d-947cf57b30f1.name: Feedback

badge_template_activities.title: Attend Session 4 of the summer series workshop- Enhanced Face-to-Face Instruction: Making D2L Work for You!
Complete Session 4 milestone included in the accompanying course.

31b42aa3-a038-4f5a-ad4f-2af5b775541f.description: The Cybersecurity Online Training Institute badge signifies that successful participants have mastered course development that is consistent with the Cybersecurity Course Instructional Design Checklist (CCIDC). The course provides a structured training to develop skills in the application of design principles such as Universal Design for Learning, course alignment, multi-modal assessments, organized course work, and instructor presence.
31b42aa3-a038-4f5a-ad4f-2af5b775541f.name: Cybersecurity Online Training Institute

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in the Cybersecurity Online Training Institute Workshop.
Complete all assignments included in the course.
Develop instructional content, assessments, and activities that are accessible to all users.
Align course goals and objectives with instructional content, assessments, and activities.
Organize course materials according to best practices cited in the workshop.
Develop and implement a plan for communication and learner feedback.

8e116a12-d688-46c6-88ff-912b1d9c90e8.description: Earners of the Enhanced Face-to-Face Instruction badge have successfully completed 12 hours of training in using specific D2L tools to improve their face-to-face course(s). Earners have demonstrated competence applying student engagement techniques for flowing between modalities; using analytical strategies to keep their content up to date; all while maintaining high accessibility standards for their online content.
8e116a12-d688-46c6-88ff-912b1d9c90e8.name: Enhanced Face-to-Face Instruction: Making D2L Work for You!

badge_template_activities.title: Attend all 6 synchronous workshops
Complete all 6 milestones included in the accompanying course.

4c9c6111-7ab9-4386-9ffb-a62516554f71.description: Individuals who have earned this credential have completed the Next-Gen Mini-MBA offered by the Cox Family Enterprise Center at KSU. Earners have demonstrated a deep understanding of Family Business Leadership: Integrating Ownership/Family Governance, Corporate Governance Benefit, Building Strong Enterprising Families, Organizational Strategy, Conflict Management Strategies, Strategic Financial Management, Emotional Intelligence & Communication Skills, High Performing Succession & Continuity.
4c9c6111-7ab9-4386-9ffb-a62516554f71.name: Next-Gen Leadership Excellence Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Completed 100 hours of in-person classroom instruction
Completed 8 class related pre-reading assignments
Completed 2-3 assignments in between class sessions
Completed 12 hours of one-on-one coaching sessions

8a4764cc-b8ff-4813-bf43-6a3515ec7999.description: Earners of the Accessible Teaching Essentials Workshop will be introduced to accessible teaching, offering a four-step approach to accessibility, and offering opportunities to begin practicing creating accessible content. Earners are also introduced to Universal Design for Learning and given the opportunity to reflect on these principles and apply them to their courses. Importantly, earners are introduced to resources for checking their content for accessibility and they practice checking it.
8a4764cc-b8ff-4813-bf43-6a3515ec7999.name: Accessible Teaching Essentials

badge_template_activities.title: Discuss ethical and legal ramifications of disability and accessibility.
Identify resources and strategies for developing accessible courses for students with disabilities.
Apply Universal Design for Learning Principles to course content.
Practice creating accessible documents and course content.
Check course content for accessibility issues.

25b0bcf0-2626-4fc1-9f88-c16b8aab47fd.description: Completion of four advanced courses in digital and social media knowledge including digital design, creating a social media plan, creating a social media strategy, and writing a social media use policy for a company or organization.
25b0bcf0-2626-4fc1-9f88-c16b8aab47fd.name: Digital and Social Media

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 4 graduate-level courses.
Create a professional social media use policy for a company or organization.
Develop complete social media strategy for a client.
Create social media graphics, business cards, inforgraphics and booklet, and stand-up banners.

b14a12dc-08c0-4ece-9837-ffc6bdb54ef1.description: Individuals who have earned this credential have completed the Innovation White Belt Program offered by the Michael J. Coles of Business at Kennesaw State University. These Digital Badge earners have demonstrated a deep understanding of the fundamentals of business innovation: Understanding Value Creation, Mastering the Discovery Process, Prototyping for Learning, Prototyping for Funding, Monetizing the Innovation, and Innovating the Business Model.
b14a12dc-08c0-4ece-9837-ffc6bdb54ef1.name: Innovation White Belt

badge_template_activities.title: Completed 5 program levels related to business innovation.
Completed 16 quests and 80 learning challenges.
Completed 8 work-related to-do assignments.
Completed approximately 30 hours of online learning.

d2e67bf1-dbca-4a0b-aede-a7a0c5e61666.description: The Connected Learning for Littles Masterclass is designed to help educators learn new and innovative practices around Maker centered and Project-Based learning giving students the ability to design and build, acquire news skills such as critical thinking collaboration, communication, and creating new ways of thinking about the world around them.
d2e67bf1-dbca-4a0b-aede-a7a0c5e61666.name: Masterclass: Connected Learning for Littles

badge_template_activities.title: Content includes materials on Maker Education, Curriculum Connections, Digital Making, and Making to Serve, Project Based Learning, and Planning & Assessing in a Project-Based Learning environment.

1bc80b00-c3b0-48ea-a653-ff444a7d14f7.description: The Connected Learning Design and Development badge is awarded after successful completion of the Connected Learning Design and Development Masterclass.
1bc80b00-c3b0-48ea-a653-ff444a7d14f7.name: Masterclass: Connected Learning Design and Development
